texts.text: Welcome to your FLASH RETAIL Enterprise Maturity Assessment. This survey features 16 questions about your company’s business from end-to-end. We will deliver immediate, personalized insights (at no cost) to help you accelerate positive business outcomes for your company. Begin by assessing your current retail maturity across three areas:
• Customer Experience
• Management & Operations
• Organization & Culture
Survey completion instructions:
•Select one or more of the following options for each question that applies to your company.
•If the answer is not provided, you have more detail to include, or the question is not applicable, select “Additional comments” and type your comments in the box.
•For responses asking for a percent, indicate numbers only without “%” sign (e.g., 20, NOT 0.2 or 20%).

•You must complete at least 5 questions to submit, and you will only receive results on the questions answered. You can come back at any time to complete and resubmit your survey for more comprehensive results. You can also invite a colleague to collaborate and answer questions to help you complete the survey questions.
By entering data in this survey, you agree to the VLM terms and conditions and privacy policy.
Flash Retail Assessment
Business Function
Please select the primary business function that best represents your department or area within the organization:
Commerce
CRM

Transformation

texts.text: Job Role

C-Suite
Individual Contributor
Sr. Manager/Manager
SVP/VP

Individual Contributor

texts.text: Customer Experience
Customer Centricity
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
How does your enterprise leverage customer data to drive optimal business outcomes?
There is a clear, documented focus on “Customers First” to improve satisfaction, loyalty and advocacy
Real-time customer service is provided across multiple channels to deliver positive outcomes
A customer feedback program is embedded throughout the customer journey
Customer profile data is unified across all touchpoints (e.g., in-store, online, in-app, service, etc.), accessible by teams, and utilized to improve customer experiences
Customers can control their personal data and know how that data will be used and protected
None of these apply

options.text: There is a clear, documented focus on “Customers First” to improve satisfaction, loyalty and advocacy
Real-time customer service is provided across multiple channels to deliver positive outcomes
A customer feedback program is embedded throughout the customer journey
Customer profile data is unified across all touchpoints (e.g., in-store, online, in-app, service, etc.), accessible by teams, and utilized to improve customer experiences
Customers can control their personal data and know how that data will be used and protected
None of these apply

texts.text: Commerce Experience
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your enterprise offer a streamlined commerce experience to optimize conversion and revenue?
Product pages have comprehensive information, fulfillment and payment details to make an informed purchase decision
Dynamic search surfaces accurate results based on product information taxonomy and consumer behavior
User-generated information, such as ratings and reviews, questions and answers, and customer imagery, exist to provide product credibility
A single-page, simplified checkout process exists and includes multiple payment and fulfillment options
Loyalty program benefits are integrated throughout customer’s purchase journey
None of these apply

options.text: Product pages have comprehensive information, fulfillment and payment details to make an informed purchase decision
Dynamic search surfaces accurate results based on product information taxonomy and consumer behavior
User-generated information, such as ratings and reviews, questions and answers, and customer imagery, exist to provide product credibility
A single-page, simplified checkout process exists and includes multiple payment and fulfillment options
Loyalty program benefits are integrated throughout customer’s purchase journey
None of these apply

texts.text: Omnichannel Experience
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your company provide a unified commerce experience so customers receive products when, where, and how they want them?
Inventory is visible across all channels (e.g., on-site, in-store, app) to help customers make purchase decisions
Inventory is available across all channels, and products out of stock in one channel can be delivered to the customer from another channel
Omnichannel shipping and delivery options are available (i.e., buy online and pick up in store, deliver from store, ship to home)
Customers with an account can transition their shopping cart from one channel to another when signed in
Additional shopping options exist beyond in-store and direct site (e.g., app, social media, live video stream, marketplace)
None of these apply

options.text: Inventory is visible across all channels (e.g., on-site, in-store, app) to help customers make purchase decisions
Inventory is available across all channels, and products out of stock in one channel can be delivered to the customer from another channel
Omnichannel shipping and delivery options are available (i.e., buy online and pick up in store, deliver from store, ship to home)
Customers with an account can transition their shopping cart from one channel to another when signed in
Additional shopping options exist beyond in-store and direct site (e.g., app, social media, live video stream, marketplace)
None of these apply

texts.text: Personalization
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your company provide relevant customer experiences to build long-lasting relationships?
Behavioral data is used to deliver relevant search results and product recommendations
Customer-provided data and transactional data is used to personalize purchase, loyalty and marketing experiences
All customer data is integrated and used to personalize customer service experiences
A consistent, personalized experience is delivered across all customer engagements, purchase and marketing channels (i.e., email, organic/paid search, paid social, display/video ads)
AI and/or machine learning is used to optimize personalization
None of these apply

options.text: Behavioral data is used to deliver relevant search results and product recommendations
Customer-provided data and transactional data is used to personalize purchase, loyalty and marketing experiences
All customer data is integrated and used to personalize customer service experiences
A consistent, personalized experience is delivered across all customer engagements, purchase and marketing channels (i.e., email, organic/paid search, paid social, display/video ads)
AI and/or machine learning is used to optimize personalization
None of these apply

texts.text: Content Management
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your enterprise have a unified process for leveraging content across businesses and channels?
Influencers, customers and/or employees are utilized as a diversified content source
A strategy exists to deliver consistent, accurate and relevant content during each step of a customer’s journey
Processes exist for aggregating content and sourcing, creating, and storing it for sharing and re-use across all endpoints
Content is tracked and measured to adjust its performance in driving business objectives
Content is accurately personalized across touchpoints in the customer’s journey
None of these apply

options.text: Influencers, customers and/or employees are utilized as a diversified content source
A strategy exists to deliver consistent, accurate and relevant content during each step of a customer’s journey
Processes exist for aggregating content and sourcing, creating, and storing it for sharing and re-use across all endpoints
Content is tracked and measured to adjust its performance in driving business objectives
Content is accurately personalized across touchpoints in the customer’s journey
None of these apply

texts.text: Management & Operations
Data-Driven Management
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your enterprise interconnect data from its value network (customer, suppliers, workforce, and assets)?
Behavioral customer experience data is captured in real-time and ingested into a master data system
Business transactional data is processed in real-time and stored in a master data system
All data from customer experience data, human resources data, transactional data, and master data is integrated into centralized repository
Data and analytics are available for business stakeholders to make fact-based decisions
Advanced analytics are applied to data to uncover hidden insights and make advanced predictions
None of these apply

options.text: Behavioral customer experience data is captured in real-time and ingested into a master data system
Business transactional data is processed in real-time and stored in a master data system
All data from customer experience data, human resources data, transactional data, and master data is integrated into centralized repository
Data and analytics are available for business stakeholders to make fact-based decisions
Advanced analytics are applied to data to uncover hidden insights and make advanced predictions
None of these apply

texts.text: Merchandise Planning
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
How does your company optimize product sales based on availability, customer activity and demand?
Assortment and inventory planning is based on historical purchase data, product and storage/retail space availability
Product data is collected in real time across sales channels and locations to use in planning and demand forecasting
Assortment and replenishment planning is based on real-time stock information and changes in customer preferences and channels
Price and promotion optimization across all channels and locations is based on financial objectives, customer and product availability data
Assortments are localized and personalized using customer segment data with predictive analytics
None of these apply

options.text: Assortment and inventory planning is based on historical purchase data, product and storage/retail space availability
Product data is collected in real time across sales channels and locations to use in planning and demand forecasting
Assortment and replenishment planning is based on real-time stock information and changes in customer preferences and channels
Price and promotion optimization across all channels and locations is based on financial objectives, customer and product availability data
Assortments are localized and personalized using customer segment data with predictive analytics
None of these apply

texts.text: Supply Chain Operations
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your company have digitalized processes that enable customers to receive products and services at the cost, time and location they prefer?
Right-sized inventory fulfills omnichannel demands and avoids stock-out situations
Efficient and flexible transportation adjusts to changing demand and supply patterns
End-to-end management of reverse (returns) logistics improves customer satisfaction and reduces churn
Data-driven insights lead to optimized decisions, reducing risk of retail demand miscalculations
Network partners collaborate closely to provide end-to-end supply chain visibility
None of these apply

options.text: Right-sized inventory fulfills omnichannel demands and avoids stock-out situations
Efficient and flexible transportation adjusts to changing demand and supply patterns
End-to-end management of reverse (returns) logistics improves customer satisfaction and reduces churn
Data-driven insights lead to optimized decisions, reducing risk of retail demand miscalculations
Network partners collaborate closely to provide end-to-end supply chain visibility
None of these apply

texts.text: Financial Management
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your company have optimized financial management processes to drive cost efficiency, profit maximization and cash/liquidity management?
A Single Source of Truth exists for all transactions at the location, division and line of business level for consistent financial information
Revenue information is detailed to understand all factors contributing to the growth of the business (same-store, channel, product mix, etc.)
Customer profitability is analyzed to drive customer acquisition and retention strategies that lead to higher revenues and lower costs
Macro business metrics are analyzed to understand target customer buying trends, segments and behaviors
Sales Channel views show real-time profitability to address challenges that influence mix, line, and channel course corrections
None of these apply

options.text: A Single Source of Truth exists for all transactions at the location, division and line of business level for consistent financial information
Revenue information is detailed to understand all factors contributing to the growth of the business (same-store, channel, product mix, etc.)
Customer profitability is analyzed to drive customer acquisition and retention strategies that lead to higher revenues and lower costs
Macro business metrics are analyzed to understand target customer buying trends, segments and behaviors
Sales Channel views show real-time profitability to address challenges that influence mix, line, and channel course corrections
None of these apply

texts.text: Planning & Performance
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your enterprise have short-term and long-term performance goals that are planned, measured, and reported against consistently?
Long-term organizational goals are broken down into a detailed P&L and financial plan to drive the direction of the business
Specific goals/budgets are set for each part of the business (eCommerce, Store Operations, Marketing, Logistics, etc.) and roll up to the larger financial plan
Performance against financial plans is reviewed by key business stakeholders on a regular basis (at least monthly)
Financial plans are re-forecasted regularly based on performance and changing circumstances (both internal and external circumstances)
Operational adjustments are made based on the performance against financial plans
None of these apply

options.text: Long-term organizational goals are broken down into a detailed P&L and financial plan to drive the direction of the business
Specific goals/budgets are set for each part of the business (eCommerce, Store Operations, Marketing, Logistics, etc.) and roll up to the larger financial plan
Performance against financial plans is reviewed by key business stakeholders on a regular basis (at least monthly)
Financial plans are re-forecasted regularly based on performance and changing circumstances (both internal and external circumstances)
Operational adjustments are made based on the performance against financial plans
None of these apply

texts.text: Organization & Culture
Business Strategy
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your enterprise have a foundation for growth that drives the direction of the company?
A defined business strategy covering all products, services and markets is leveraged often across the company and updated regularly
A distinct competitive advantage exists that drives a differentiated customer experience
Clear mission, vision and experience principles are tied to employee goals and actioned across all business capabilities
Frequent management communication and employee activation of the strategy, mission, vision and experience principles exist
Established and clear goals, KPIs and benchmarks exist with monthly monitoring and reporting at the company, team and individual level
None of these apply

options.text: A defined business strategy covering all products, services and markets is leveraged often across the company and updated regularly
A distinct competitive advantage exists that drives a differentiated customer experience
Clear mission, vision and experience principles are tied to employee goals and actioned across all business capabilities
Frequent management communication and employee activation of the strategy, mission, vision and experience principles exist
Established and clear goals, KPIs and benchmarks exist with monthly monitoring and reporting at the company, team and individual level
None of these apply

texts.text: Sustainability Operations
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your enterprise have a purpose-led strategy that creates business value and cost savings, and reduces environmental impact?
There is a commitment to executing and measuring specific ESG (environmental, social and governance) targets
The company is transparent about its ESG policies, actions and goals and how they benefit the customer, community and environment
Circular business processes exist to reduce and re-use materials, end-products and/or packaging
Donations to charitable causes are made by the company, and customers are encouraged to participate
ESG initiatives and progress are proactively communicated to customers and stakeholders
None of these apply

options.text: There is a commitment to executing and measuring specific ESG (environmental, social and governance) targets
The company is transparent about its ESG policies, actions and goals and how they benefit the customer, community and environment
Circular business processes exist to reduce and re-use materials, end-products and/or packaging
Donations to charitable causes are made by the company, and customers are encouraged to participate
ESG initiatives and progress are proactively communicated to customers and stakeholders
None of these apply

texts.text: Workforce Management
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Is your company effective in managing current and future talent needs?
We have the ability to find and hire the talent we need to support our business operations
New hires are onboarded efficiently and effectively to increase speed to full productivity
Employees are provided with the training and development resources they need to perform their current jobs and take on future job assignments
Employees are regularly reviewed against well-defined performance expectations associated with their job role
Employees clearly understand how their actions and performance influence company compensation and promotion decisions
None of these apply

options.text: We have the ability to find and hire the talent we need to support our business operations
New hires are onboarded efficiently and effectively to increase speed to full productivity
Employees are provided with the training and development resources they need to perform their current jobs and take on future job assignments
Employees are regularly reviewed against well-defined performance expectations associated with their job role
Employees clearly understand how their actions and performance influence company compensation and promotion decisions
None of these apply

texts.text: HR Operations
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your organization have efficient and effective HR operations that reflect leading practices?
The organization is structured so that team roles, responsibilities and accountabilities support the needs of the business
Managers can easily access HR data to create, update, and publish reports they need to make decisions
HR systems integrate with non-HR systems such as finance, security access, procurement, and supply chain to support business operations
HR processes are automated so employees do not spend time doing repetitive, non-value added administrative tasks
Processes are in place to ensure HR practices comply with local regulations and laws in all countries of operation
None of these apply

options.text: The organization is structured so that team roles, responsibilities and accountabilities support the needs of the business
Managers can easily access HR data to create, update, and publish reports they need to make decisions
HR systems integrate with non-HR systems such as finance, security access, procurement, and supply chain to support business operations
HR processes are automated so employees do not spend time doing repetitive, non-value added administrative tasks
Processes are in place to ensure HR practices comply with local regulations and laws in all countries of operation
None of these apply

texts.text: Building Culture
Select one or more that apply to your enterprise:
Does your company have a culture that promotes innovation, collaboration, diversity and inclusion?
Strategic goals are tied to non-monetary objectives such as employee well-being, workforce diversity and environmental sustainability
The organization effectively supports the use of remote and hybrid working models
Employee feedback data is used to improve experience
Leadership strategy and decisions are communicated transparently so employees understand how they impact their roles
Culture encourages innovation, experimentation and testing without fear of failure
None of these apply

options.text: Strategic goals are tied to non-monetary objectives such as employee well-being, workforce diversity and environmental sustainability
The organization effectively supports the use of remote and hybrid working models
Employee feedback data is used to improve experience
Leadership strategy and decisions are communicated transparently so employees understand how they impact their roles
Culture encourages innovation, experimentation and testing without fear of failure
None of these apply

texts.text: Business Priorities
Indicate percent of company’s focus (sum to total 100%):
What percent of your goals are currently driving your business strategy?
Core top-line growth (focus on growing revenue and profitability)
Cost reduction (focus on managing costs and cost-saving initiatives)
Differentiated customer experiences (developing new products/services)
Capturing new market or segment opportunities
Reactive to industry pressures (guarding company against threats & taking necessary action)
